args: Hey! That was MY apple,\nyou big dumb APPLE THIEF!

Gya! Are you trying to kill me?!
Also, how was I supposed to know
you'd claimed that particular apple?
It's not as if your name was on it!
Oh, so now I have to write my name on\neverything I don't want you horfing down?!
If you're so hungry, I've got a knuckle\nsandwich for you right here!
Whoa, calm down, tiger! I mean, I'm a\nthousand percent with you on this, but let's\nmaybe take it easy on the ol' violence.
Be careful with that apple thief!\nHe's the only brother you've got,\nso you don't wanna break him!
...Ugh. Those two are ex-HAUSTING.\nI need to go catch my breath.
It is rare to see you alone.
Is something amiss, child?\nYou lack your usual vigor.
I was trying to break up another of\nSarisse and Luca's spats, but...\nWell, you know how they are.
I tell you, family can be one heck of a ride.
I mean, I ASSUME it can be? I don't\nactually know any of my own relatives.\nTo be honest, I envy those two a little.
What's it like, Midgardsormr?\nHaving a family, I mean.
I hear dragons and faeries are supposed\nto be distant relatives, you know?
I have also heard as much.
Hey, I'm getting a brilliant idea!\nYou and me shou—
No, hear me out: we can pretend to be\ngramps and granddaughter and see what\nit's REALLY like to have a family!
I take it I am ＂gramps＂ in this scenario?
What, you'd rather be the granddaughter?\nI mean, it's a little weird, but I'm down.
I have lived for untold ages and been\nknown by a thousand names, but none\nhave ever called me...＂gramps.＂
Yeah, sorry. It's just that... Well, I don't\nreally know any other faeries I can ask.
There's nobody I can claim a blood relation\nto except you dragons. *sniff*
...Oh, very well. If it will lift your spirits,\nI will indulge you. But only for a moment.
I brought some berries I picked to share\nwith my favorite grandpa!
Given your size, I worry I may swallow you\nalong with the fruit.
Eeek! Nevermind. I mean, I love berries,\nbut not quite to death. ...Sorry, berries.
Oh, hey, I know! Let's switch and have\nYOU feed ME! Ready? Aaaaaaaah...
Do you truly wish me to hand-feed you?
Actually, no. To be honest, this whole\nidea kinda got away from me there.
You know, we spent the whole day trying,\nbut I'm not sure we were doing it right.
Like, that business with the berries kinda\nstrayed out of gramps and granddaughter\nzone and right into the couples zone.
And I mean, you're a very nice dragon—\nand handsome in a lizard-y kind of way—\nbut I just see you as a friend. Sorry.
What is this bizarre feeling of rejection...?
Enough! We digress. Do you at least feel\nthat you have gleaned some insight into\nthe nature of family?
Nope! Not even a little bit.\nI did learn SOMETHING, though.
Even the dumbest game of make-believe\ncan be a lot of fun with the right friend!
I didn't learn a darn thing about family,\nbut I DID have a blast not learning it!
Blood's not the only kind of family:\nI can laugh and cry and whatever\nwith people I love just as easily.
AND I can get in dumb fights over fruit\nand make up afterwards—pretty close\nto Luca and Sarisse, huh?
That's quite a lot of nothing you've learned.
Hear me, Notte: It was not their blood that\nallowed them to make amends—it was a\ndeep mutual understanding.
All living things can forge bonds and find\nconnection with one another.
At times, even bonds stronger than blood.\nThose are treasures to be cherished.
Yeah! I mean, {player_name}\nand Zethia and all those guys are all like\nfamily to me already, right?
Maybe even more important than family!\n...I'm including you in that, Midgardsormr.
Aw, thanks, buddy. I feel a lot better now.
Well, it's gotten pretty dark out,\nso I should head back to the castle.
Very well. Take care, little faerie.
I will! Thanks again for teaching me all\nthat junk today.
...Heh. I don't mind the sound of that\nnearly as much as I should.
